fieldDescription:
If this option is enabled, the main features of this mod will be disabled, re-enabling building in hullmods with story points and disabling all mastery effects.

Note that this does not disable this mod's skill changes, nor does it remove additional content not related to the mastery system.
You will need to manually revert this mod's skill changes by deleting the "replace" property in "Ship Mastery System/mod_info.json" and deleting or renaming "Ship Mastery System/data/characters/skills". This will require a full application reload to take effect.

If enabled, all masteries are randomized except for the guaranteed 3 S-mod capacity masteries, which may appear at any level. Disables tier requirements from mastery selection criteria and removes the option to select between two different masteries at certain levels.

Requires main mod features to be enabled.

If enabled, player ships that are lost in battle but not recovered will be spawned as derelicts. When losing or disengaging from a battle, ships that would have been recoverable if the player had decisively won are spawned as derelicts.

If enabled, saves the 10 most recent player battles, allowing them to be replayed at any time with your current fleet. Battles can also be pinned, saving them permanently.

If precise mode is enabled, exact ship variants will be saved to file, ensuring that the same ships that were fought in the field are fought in replay, but this may make your save file noticeably larger.
Otherwise, only the fleets' inflaters will be saved, meaning variations in ship loadouts may occur due to setting changes, or poorly-seeded or unseeded inflaters.

If enabled, adds a checkbox to the autofit window that, when checked, will attempt to copy installed S-mods from the goal variant during the autofit process. May conflict with other mods that modify the refit screen autofit behavior.
If enabled, the option to clear S-mods from a ship is always enabled. Otherwise, it must be acquired from a mastery effect.
Refunds the specified fraction of MP and credits spent when clearing S-mods that were installed by the player using the mastery interface.
Multiplies the amount of MP gained for non-civilian ship hulls from actions that also grant XP.
Multiplies the amount of MP gained for civilian ship hulls from actions that also grant XP.
Multiplies the credits cost of building in hullmods by the specified amount.
Each time you regenerate randomly-selected masteries, the MP cost of the next regeneration (for that ship spec) increases by this amount.
Seed to use for randomly generated mastery effects, applied to all new games. If left empty or whitespace only, the sector seed will be used instead.
For options that require a double-click to confirm, sets the time window for a subsequent click to register as a double-click.
If enabled, displays current mastery points and level next to each ship while in the refit screen.
If enabled, the mastery panel will include a button to copy the current save's mastery generation seed, for debugging purposes.
Sets the highlight color for ship mastery currency counters in the refit screen.
Sets the highlight color for general highlighted text and positive effects in the mastery selection panel.
Sets the highlight color for negative effects in the mastery selection panel.

defaultValue: All settings in this category only apply to NPC fleets that have not yet been processed by this mod.

fieldDescription: If [enabled], NPC fleet difficulty settings will [gradually progress] from their initial to their final values. If [disabled], difficulty settings will [remain at their initial values indefinitely].

If progression is enabled, controls the [rate] at which NPC fleets' mastery settings progress. The final settings are reached when the player gains the selected number of [MP across all combat ship hulls]. This number only counts MP gained directly from combat, and not MP gained through constructs or passively for skins of a ship hull.
The initial [flat modifier] to the [average mastery level] that ship hulls in NPC fleets will spawn with.
The final [flat modifier] to the [average mastery level] that ship hulls in NPC fleets will spawn with.
